name: Simply 3 Collection - Purple Cranes Evase Dress
description:
This Evase Dress is made with a really soft mid-weight blended fabric, 
so even though you'll be looking great and put-together, you'll still be comfortable. The combination with a fabric's distinctive traditional japanese fabric makes a 
classy and dynamic effect. Perfect for going out or going to work. 
The evase skirt is both flirty and practical, with a flat simple sabrina or a colorful stiletto. You choose! 
This dress has a way of fitting everyone who tries it on. This awesome dress is extremely comfortable. The dress hangs naturally. Great for all body types! 
Each dress is truly one-of-a-kind. One unique model, with a combination of vintage and imported buttons to make that detail point out! 
Chosen exactly for each dress singularity.

Available in Deep Black/ Red Chique/ Royal Purple.

FABRIC: 
Tri-blend synthetic: 86% polyester; 10% viscose; 4% elastane (spandex).

FIT: 
Incredible. This dress is designed to fit and flatter a wide range of body types, and is always stunning and sophisticated. 
Relaxed fit through the bodice, full flirty skirt.

CARE: 
Hand wash or machine wash till 40º, hang dry. Do not tumble dry. Iron on synthetich heat.

Dimensions/Weight 
Front Length: 87cm 
Weight: 365grs

SIZE: 
Available in: 
UK/IRL:10 
ES/PT:38 
France:36 
Germany:34 
US:8

name: Antique Original Southeastern United States Map 1947
description:
Southeastern United States Map 1947 Original
The Southeastern United States map appeared in National Geographic Magazine in February 1947. Particular attention is paid to the Atlantic coastlines with insets of the South Carolina and Georgia coasts, and Cape Hatteras and Norfolk. It also features an inset of the lower Mississippi region including New Orleans.

The 1947 Southeastern United States map features:
• Insets of Littoral of Cape Hatteras and Norfolk, the South Carolina and Georgia coasts, and the lower Mississippi
• Capitals, cities, and towns
• Mountain relief, rivers, lakes, and swamps
• U.S. highways, state highways, principal railways, canals, and intracoastal waterway
• Battlefields
• Appalachian Trail
Coverage Area: Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Alabama, Louisiana, Bahama Islands, eastern Missouri, southern Illinois, southern Indiana, southern Ohio, northeastern Arkansas

Dim:  27" x 31"

About the Editor, Gilbert Grosvenor:

Gilbert Hovey Grosvenor, the father of photojournalism, was the first full-time editor of National Geographic Magazine, serving from 1899 to 1954. Grosvenor is credited with having built the magazine into the iconic publication that it is today
Grosvenor was responsible for the development of the National Geographic's commitment to photo journalism. Photography confirmed Grosvenor's conviction, "If the National Geographic Magazine is to progress, it must constantly improve the quality of its illustrations," Geographic pictures were scarce when he began his editorship, so he bought a camera, paying a month's salary for it, and embarked on six decades of picture-taking.
The magazine was a plain-covered journal when it first started. The beautiful photographs became part of the journal after Gilbert H. Grosvenor became editor-in-chief for the publication in 1904. 
In 1920, Grosvenor took on a second role as president of the National Geographic Society, which publishes the magazine. Born in Turkey on October 28, 1875, Grosvenor is credited with transforming National Geographic into a world-renowned monthly magazine.
Under Grosvenor's guidance, scientific expeditions and research projects traveled as far as the North Pole with Commodore Robert Peary in 1909, and as deep as the ocean when William Beebe made his record-setting undersea descent in 1934.
Today, the National Geographic Society is the largest nonprofit scientific and educational organization of its kind. Grosvenor cared a great deal about conservation and the protection of wildlife, and both causes are the subject of many of the current programs and educational materials offered by the society.

With the money earned from the magazine, the society was able to explore previously unknown worlds, then introduce them to millions of people

name: Antique - 1942 National Geographic Map, North America, WWII, Original
description:
1942 National Geographic Map, North America, WWII, Original 

The North America map of May 1942 shows the continent just months after Japan attacked Pearl Harbor, bringing the United States into World War II. U.S. Naval bases are noted and an inset map of the Aleutian Islands is included.

Measures 28" wide by 31.25" tall.
Format: Wall/ Poster Map
Map Type: Countries/ Borders, Geological/ Terrain, Historical/ Political. 

The 1942 North America map features:
• Inset map of the Aleutian Islands
• Capitals of countries, states, and provinces, and major cities
• Railways, highways, and projected highways
• Mountain ranges, major rivers, major lakes, and glaciers
• Naval bases
• Ruins
Coverage Area: North America, Greenland, Iceland, Central America, West Indies, Columbia, Venezuela

Appearing in the May 1942 issue of the National Geographic Magazine,  only seen in National Geographic Magazine. This reproduction holds true to the high standards that National Geographic Maps are known for.




About the Editor, Gilbert Grosvenor:

Gilbert Hovey Grosvenor, the father of photojournalism, was the first full-time editor of National Geographic Magazine, serving from 1899 to 1954. Grosvenor is credited with having built the magazine into the iconic publication that it is today
Grosvenor was responsible for the development of the National Geographic's commitment to photo journalism. Photography confirmed Grosvenor's conviction, "If the National Geographic Magazine is to progress, it must constantly improve the quality of its illustrations," Geographic pictures were scarce when he began his editorship, so he bought a camera, paying a month's salary for it, and embarked on six decades of picture-taking.
The magazine was a plain-covered journal when it first started. The beautiful photographs became part of the journal after Gilbert H. Grosvenor became editor-in-chief for the publication in 1904. 
In 1920, Grosvenor took on a second role as president of the National Geographic Society, which publishes the magazine. Born in Turkey on October 28, 1875, Grosvenor is credited with transforming National Geographic into a world-renowned monthly magazine.
Under Grosvenor's guidance, scientific expeditions and research projects traveled as far as the North Pole with Commodore Robert Peary in 1909, and as deep as the ocean when William Beebe made his record-setting undersea descent in 1934.
Today, the National Geographic Society is the largest nonprofit scientific and educational organization of its kind. Grosvenor cared a great deal about conservation and the protection of wildlife, and both causes are the subject of many of the current programs and educational materials offered by the society.

With the money earned from the magazine, the society was able to explore previously unknown worlds, then introduce them to millions of people

name: Vintage Amber Glass Cup - Vine Style 1950s
description:
This is a vintage amber glass cup raised pattern vines design. It has a unique feature motif of scrolls and flowers. There is a fine geometric and tiny bubbles texture throughout. 
It's a Retro 1950s houseware. 
There is a band around the piece that has a pretty floral golden pattern around it. This piece is in excellent condition with no chips, cracks or repairs.

It measures 10 cm height, 8 cm diameter, and the glass has 0.5 cm of thickness.

name: Vintage Style Victorian Floral Cigar Case Lighter
description:
This is a Ladies Purse lighter and case with a floral Victorian style. 
A very good collectible item, it has a similar Vans lighters style.

There are 2 clips inside that hold the cigarettes in (you just lift them up when you want one).

The chromium firing mechanism is similar to Kreisler/Colibri lighters. To light, just quickly slide the firing trigger away from the wick. Release and the snuffer caps snaps back into place, extinguishing the flame. New flint, no fuel.

It measures 11,5 cm long, 5 cm width, and 2 cm.

name: Spring - Bifold Card Wallet
description:
All in one wallet, you have one pocket to insert money and coins, with a porper colored zipper, other second open pocket to your receipts, and other NIWP (Non-Identified-Wallet-Papers) and lots of card pockets for our inumerous women cards! :)

It has a vintage button matching non-produced anymore! :)

ONE UNIQUE MODEL!

Dim: 22/11 cm when closed

This is a quality wallet: 
-Exterior fabric is a japanese strong kimono quality cotton. 
-Lining is a colored cotton, i.e. canvas, twill (money can be dirty!) 
-Double stitching at all stress points.

name: Red Mums Kimono Bag - Itaya Naomi Japanese Fabric
description:
This is a granny bag made with an actual kimono fabric, it has a satin finish.:) It has a retro button to close and 2 inside pockets! The interior has cheerful red with white little sakuras also traditional fabric, lovely to match with the Itaya Naomi satin! :)

dim:

handles - 27 cm 
bag: 34/40 cm

Brighten up your wardrobe with this beautiful japanese red kimono bag, and go out to have fun! Lovely with a black dress and some cute red stilettos!

name: Amy Butler Cherry Blossoms - Granny Bag
description:
This is a granny bag made with an actual Amy Butler fabric. :) It has a wooden button to close and 2 inside pockets! The interior has a pink dotted linen, lovely to match with the cherry blossoms! :)

dim:

handles - 27 cm 
bag: 34/40 cm

Brighten up your wardrobe with this beautiful japanese kimono bag, and go out to have fun! Lovely with a black dress and some cute white stilettos!
